journal-meta.journal-title: Proceedings of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Part C: Journal of Mechanical Engineering Science

title-group.article-title: Design and research of a novel type of mechanical presses driven by three servo motors in parallel

contrib-group.aff: State Key Laboratory of Mechanical System and Vibration, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China

author-notes.corresp: Chunxiang Ma, State Key Laboratory of Mechanical System and Vibration, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai 200240, China. Email: cxma@sjtu.edu.cn

abstract.p: A novel type of mechanical presses design driven by three servo motors in parallel is proposed to develop high stamping capacity based on the theory of generalized function sets, and then is improved to enhance its practicability in engineering practice. The inverse and forward kinematics analyses are conducted later. Based on the fuzzy probability theory, the computing method of fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider is then obtained. Finally, with a set of optimized length parameters of the presses given, the fuzzy reliability is calculated, on the basis of which a typical deep-drawing process is simulated.

sec.title: Introduction
sec.p: Stamping, as a fast and cost-effective forming process, has been utilized in a wide range of areas. The traditional mechanical presses have high mechanical efficiency due to the energy stored in flywheel, which could be released during working cycles leading to low mechanical losses. However, as the dimension parameters of the presses are fixed, the presses can merely have a fixed motion curve of the slider. Nevertheless, servo mechanical presses are driven by servo motors, which can achieve lower noise, higher mechanical efficiency, programmable stroke and excellent precision.1–6 However, most of the previous studies are directed at the presses with single degree of freedom, whose driving torque comes from merely one motor. Due to the limits of power of servomotor, the presses driven by one servomotor can not meet the requirements of heavy duty. Although Du and Guo7 have proposed a hybrid actuation-type servo mechanical presses prototype with a 2 degrees-of-freedom seven-bar linkage mechanism, which uses an ordinary motor with a flywheel to produce majority of the force and a servomotor to adjust the performance at the same time, the capacity of strengthening duty remains limited. In this case, it is a new topic to adopt parallel mechanisms to design heavy-duty presses in this field.

Parallel mechanisms have been employed in a great deal of fields, and the requirement of developing parallel mechanisms with specific characteristics has been increasingly important, and many novel and practical parallel mechanisms have been proposed.8–11 The type synthesis of multi-degree-of-freedom robotic mechanisms has been recognized as one of the most popular research subjects in the last few decades. Mathematical tools in use include the graph theory,12 the Lie group theory,13–15 the screw theory,16,17 linear transformation,18 and position and orientation characteristics equation.19 During these years, a novel theory, generalized function sets20 (GF sets for short), and a new method for the type synthesis of parallel mechanisms based on this theory has been introduced to the field.21,22

The reliability of specific machine’s operation is being questioned due to the possible presence of discrepancies during component machining and assembling. Therefore, it is vital to conduct an error analysis and quantitative calculation of such discrepancies for designated mechanism. In 1960s, Bruyervitch23 conducted research on kinematic accuracy of specific mechanisms. In the middle 1980s, Sandler24 moved forward and brought the concept of statistics and probability into the analysis. Recently, researchers all over the world also have achieved quite a range of accomplishments in this field. Fuzzy theory25–27 also finds wide applications in the field of reliability of mechanical products. While, with study on parallel mechanism getting more and more intensified, the reliability of parallel mechanism attracts researchers’ attention. Yang et al.28 proposed a new method for evaluating the reliability of parallel mechanism. However, the accuracy of this method is not enough to meet the requirement of engineering practice.

In this article, a novel type of mechanical presses design driven by three servo motors in parallel is proposed to develop high stamping capacity based on the theory of GF sets, and then is improved to enhance its practicability. A matching control system is also developed, which is followed by the inverse and forward kinematics analysis. Based on the fuzzy probability theory, the computing method of fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider is then obtained. In the last section, with a set of optimized length parameters of the presses given, the fuzzy reliability is calculated, on the basis of which a typical deep-drawing process is simulated.

sec.title: Design of a novel type of mechanical press based on GF sets
sec.p: The theory of GF sets is introduced for characterizing end-effectors of parallel mechanisms and describing performance criteria of robotic manipulator end-effectors in a clear and systematic way. A novel method for the type synthesis of parallel mechanisms based on GF sets has been proposed, which relies on no reference coordinate system required except for the intersection operation of GF sets, therefore, it is used more and more widely.

Generally, mechanical presses consist of two parts: active limbs and passive limbs. The end-effector (the moving platform) of the active limbs of the mechanical press in this design has 3D translations and 1D rotation with characteristics of GFI(Ta Tb Tc, Ra 0 0). On basis of the GF sets theory, two possible types of active limbs can be designed which are shown in Table 1 and Figure 1. Here, P, R and Pa denote prismatic pair, revolute pair and parallelogram compound pair, respectively. Figure 1.
Types of active limbs having 3D translations and 1D rotation.
Table 1.
Types of active limbs having 3D translations and 1D rotation.
Type of limb Conditions Figure
PRPaR Rotation axes of R are parallel to the rotation axes of Pa and perpendicular to the direction of movement of P (a)
RRPaR Rotation axes of Pa are perpendicular to other rotation axes (b)

In parallel mechanical presses, the passive limbs which serve as output limbs are connected to the slider and the moving platform on its two ends. Symmetrical toggle mechanism (shown in Figure 2(a)) is the basic type for the passive limb, which is denoted as PR. Figure 2.
Types of passive limbs based on symmetrical toggle mechanism: PR, PRR, and PRPa.

When connected to a revolute pair, it is equivalently denoted as PRR with characteristics of GFI(Ta Tb 0, Ra 0 0); when connected to a parallelogram compound pair, it is equivalently denoted as PRPa with characteristics of GFI(Ta Tb Tc, Ra 0 0), which are shown in Figure 2(b) and (c).

According to the algorithm of intersection of GF sets, the types of RRPaR and PRPa, as active limbs and passive limbs, respectively, are utilized to design the parallel presses which is illustrated in Figure 3, in which three sets of active limbs RRPaR are set in parallel to compose the driving part of the presses. Here, the reason why only three servomotors are used is that the driving part of the presses with three motors is a 3D body unlike the counterpart with 2 motors which is merely 2D one and this research as a basic study to some extent can be extended to the cases with more motors considering the requirements under the specific circumstances which still are 3D bodies and feasible according to the theory of GF sets. Figure 3.
3D model of the presses designed based on RRPaR and PRPa.

However, in the practical process of developing high payload presses, the rods with parallelogram compound pair, which do not have the enough capacity of sustaining high payload and may decrease the kinematics accuracy of presses due to the presence of more hinge gaps, are replaced by common rods without any additional joints. Additionally, an improved symmetrical toggle mechanism is utilized in which two links are replaced by two triangle plates in order to increase the force increasing ratio. Consequently, the prototype of design is improved to enhance the utility in engineering practice. Although the mechanism is over-constrained, it cannot influence the virtual work of presses with the slider conducting a type of up-and-down motion by virtue of advanced servomotors and suitable control strategy that are capable to achieve surpassingly accurate control. Plenty of controllers can narrow the scanning cycle to 0.5 ms even smaller and numerous control systems can meet the requirements of high-level synchronism and real time. The 3D model of this new type of mechanical presses used in practical process is shown in Figure 4.29 Figure 4.
3D model of the presses: (1) motor-crank-connecting rod mechanism; (2) moving platform; (3) slider bar; (4) symmetrical toggle mechanism; (5) slider.

As shown in Figure 4, the model of the mechanical presses consists of three sets of motor-crank-connecting rod mechanisms (1), a moving platform (2), two slider bars (3), two sets of symmetrical toggle mechanism (4) and a slider (5).

The mechanical presses are driven by three servo motors in parallel, in which the driving part is different from other presses with three servo motors driving a moving platform with the shape of equilateral triangle. The three vertical planes, where the three sets of motor-crank-connecting rod mechanisms are allocated individually, intersect with each other on the geometrical axis of moving platform while each other is 120° apart from the rests, respectively. When the presses work, three cranks are driven by the three motors respectively with synchronized motion and hence drive the three connecting rods to swing. As a result, the moving platform merely moves up and down in the vertical direction. Consequentially, with the driving force from symmetrical toggle mechanism articulated with the slider bar, the slider conducts a type of up-and-down motion to accomplish stamping process.

sec.title: Inverse kinematics
sec.p: For servo-motivated parallel presses, since the output curve is planned and given, it is essential to analyze the inverse kinematics of mechanism to obtain the control law of servomotors.

As shown in Figure 4, a Cartesian coordinate system OXYZ is established, the origin of the coordinate system is placed at the centroid of the regular triangle A1A2A3 with three vertices at three specific points of motors (Figure 5(c)). Figure 5.
Orthographic views: (a) orthographic view on coordinate plane OXZ; (b) orthographic view of the no. 1 crank-connecting rod mechanism; (c) orthographic view in the vertical direction.

From the design concept, it is verified that the driving part can be considered as three sets of eccentric slider-crank mechanisms synchronously driving the moving platform. In the process of searching inverse solution, the model of presses can be simplified as shown in Figure 5(a).

Figure 5(a) shows the orthographic view on coordinate plane OXZ, and the orthographic view of the no.1 crank-connecting rod mechanism is shown in Figure 5(b), while the orthographic view in the vertical direction in Figure 5(c). In the three figures, li and di are the lengths of links and the parameters for installation, respectively, a, b and c are the lengths of the sides of the triangle plate DEF, h1 denotes the length of the side of the regular triangle A1A2A3 and h2 is the length of the side of the triangle moving platform, θi is the angle which the links rotate, where the subscripts i = 1–9 denote the serial numbers of the corresponding parameters.
Here, the closed-loop vector method30 is applied to deduce the expression of θ1.

From Figure 5(a), the following equations are gotten (1)DE+EG+GD=0 (2)DF+FH+HD=0 (3)GE+EF+FH+HG=0 Applying vector decomposition to equations (1) and (2) yields (4){bcos(θ7+α1)-l8cosθ8+d2=0bsin(θ7+α1)-l8sinθ8+ZD-d1=0 (5){acosθ7+l9cosθ9+d2+d3=0asinθ7+l9sinθ9+ZD-ZH=0 (6){l8cosθ8+ccos(θ7-α3)+l9cosθ9+d3=0l8sinθ8+csin(θ7-α3)+l9sinθ9+d1-ZH=0 Solving equation (4) for θ8 by eliminating θ7-α3 yields (7)tanθ82=-B1+B12-4A1C12A1 where, A1=(l8+d2)2+(d1-ZD)2-b2 B1=4l8(d1-ZD) C1=(l8-d2)2+(d1-ZD)2-b2

Noting that the incorrect one of the two solutions, namely, tanθ82=-B1-B12-4A1C12A1, is eliminated on basis of one specific pose of the presses, and the similar problems in the following derivation processes are dealt with in the same way.
Similarly, solving the equations (5) for θ9 gets (8)tanθ92=-B2+B22-4A2C22A2 where, A2=(l9-d2-d3)2+(ZD-ZH)2-a2B2=4l9(ZD-ZH)C2=(l9+d2+d3)2+(ZD-ZH)2-a2
Also, eliminating θ7-α3 from equation (3) yields (9)(l8cosθ8+l9cosθ9+d3)2+(l8sinθ8+l9sinθ9+d1-ZH)2-c2=0
From universal equations, the following equations are easily derived. (10)cosθ9=(1-tan2θ92)/(1+tan2θ92) (11)sinθ9=2tanθ92/(1+tan2θ92) (12)cosθ8=(1-tan2θ82)/(1+tan2θ82) (13)sinθ8=2tanθ82/(1+tan2θ82)

Substituting them into the above equation (9) obtain a recessive equation (14)F(ZD,ZH)=0 in which, ZD and ZH act as variables, and if the value of ZH is given, that of ZD can be obtained from the equation (14) using Newton iteration method in MATLAB.
From Figure 5(a), it is easy to obtain (15)ZC=ZD-l7
From Figure 5(b), (16)A1B1+B1C1+C1A1=0 (17){l1cosθ1+l2cosθ2-e=0l1sinθ1+l2sinθ2-ZC1=0 (18)Here,ZC1=ZC
Solving the above equations for θ1 yields (19)θ1=2arctan-B3±B32-4A3C32A3 where, e=3/3·(h1-h2)A3=(l1+e)2+ZC2-l22B3=-4ZCl1C3=(l1-e)2+ZC2-l22

Here, there are two values of θ1 corresponding to one value of ZC which are in correspondence with two position of the approach and return phases. Based on this, an entire motion law of θ1 can be obtained.

sec.title: Position analysis
sec.p: Given θ1, resolving the equation (17) for ZC1 obtains (20)ZC1=l1sinθ1+l22-(l1cosθ1-e)2

To calculate the fuzzy reliability, the manufacturing error of all the links are included, and thus the expressions of ZC2 and ZC3 are required and written as follows (21)ZC2=l3sinθ3+l42-(l3cosθ3-e)2 (22)ZC3=l5sinθ5+l62-(l5cosθ5-e)2
Point C is the centroid point of the moving platform; therefore its expression is related to that of C1, C2 and C3 by the formula (23)ZC=(ZC1+ZC2+ZC3)/3
Equal to (15), the ZD is given as (24)ZD=ZC+l7
Substituting the above equations into the equation (9) gets another recessive equation (25)F(ZD,ZH)=0
Then, the equation can be used in the ‘Numerical simulation’ section.

sec.title: Velocity analysis
sec.p: The angular velocity of each link and velocity of some special points are derived by differentiating the loop closure equations (4 to 6, 17) and then solving the resulting systems of equations.
Taking the derivative of equation (17) with respect to time yields (26){-l1sinθ1θ·1-l2sinθ2θ·2=0l1cosθ1θ·1+l2cosθ2θ·2=Z·C which is equivalent to (27)[-l1sinθ1-l2sinθ2l1cosθ1l2cosθ2](θ·1θ·2)=(0Z·c)
In the same way, the following equations are deduced, (28)Z·D=Z·c (29)[bsin(θ7+α1)-l8sinθ8-bcos(θ7+α1)l8cosθ8](θ·7θ·8)=(0Z·D) (30)[-asinθ7-l9sinθ9acosθ7l9cosθ9](θ·7θ·9)=(0Z·H-Z·D)
Namely, (31)[-asinθ90-acosθ91](θ·7Z·D)=[l7sinθ70l7cosθ71](θ·7Z·D)

sec.title: Acceleration analysis
sec.p: Acceleration analysis can be performed by second order differentiating equations (4 to 6, 17) with respect to time. The results for acceleration analysis are directly presented as follows. (32)[-l1sinθ1-l2sinθ2l1cosθ1l2cosθ2](θ··1θ··2)=(0Z··C)-[-l1cosθ1-l2cosθ2-l1sinθ1-l2sinθ2](θ·12θ·22) (33)Z·D=Z·C (34)[bsin(θ7+α1)-l8sinθ8-bcos(θ7+α1)l8cosθ8](θ··7θ··8)=(0Z··D2)-[bcos(θ7+α1)-l8cosθ8-bsin(θ7+α1)l8sinθ8](θ·72θ·82) (35)[-asinθ90-acosθ91](θ··9Z··H)=[l7cosθ7acosθ9-l7sinθ7-asinθ9](θ·72θ·92) +[-l7sinθ70l7cosθ71](θ··7Z··D)

sec.title: Fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider
sec.p: Classical set theory assesses the membership of elements in the set in binary terms, that is, an element either belongs or does not belong to the set, while, fuzzy theory allows the gradual assessment of the membership of elements in a set which is described by a membership function valued in the real unit interval [0, 1]. Fuzzy reliability of slider kinematic accuracy based on fuzzy theory can overcome the unreasonable phenomena of ‘completing satisfaction or not’ of traditional methods and reflect the engineering practice to a greater extent.

sec.title: Probability distribution density function of kinematic accuracy
sec.p: The kinematic accuracy of the mechanism can be written as (36)ɛ=ΔZ=Z(L+ΔL,θ)-Z(L,θ) where Z(L,θ) denotes the ideal law of motion, while Z(L+ΔL,θ) is the actual law of motion including the length error of links.

Using Taylor’s series to express the equation at Lμ, keeping the first-order term and ignoring higher order terms, the following equation is gotten (37)ɛ=Z(Lμ,θ)+∑i=19∂Z∂li(li-liμ)-Z(L,θ) From formulation (37) it is known that ɛ(θ) follow a normal distribution, the exact parameters of which, namely, mean and variance, are given by the following equations (38)Eɛ(θ)=Z(Lμ,θ)-Z(L,θ)=0 (39)σɛ(θ)=∑i=19(∂Z∂li)2σli2(σli=li-liμ)
By some processes of calculation for verification, all values of ∂ϕ1∂li, ∂ϕ2∂li and ∂ϕ3∂li are equal to zero or far smaller than dZdli and thus can be ignored. It follows that (41)μɛ(θ)=Eɛ(θ)=0
σli can be obtained by the following equation (42)σl=IT76 where, IT7 is the standard tolerance value of length of links in the case of standard tolerance grade being equal to 7.

sec.title: Membership function of kinematic error
sec.p:
Let allowable kinematic error domain of slider be [ɛ], and fuzzy allowable zone A~={|ɛ|≤~[ɛ]}. Generally, the membership function of kinematic error which is chosen is expressed by formulae (43) and illustrated in Figure 6. (43)μA~(ɛ)={1+ɛ+[ɛ]α-[ɛ]-α<ɛ<-[ɛ]1[ɛ]≤ɛ≤-[ɛ]1-ɛ-[ɛ]α[ɛ]≤ɛ≤[ɛ]+α0the other The formulae and figure above show, for [ɛ]≤ɛ≤-[ɛ], the membership is equal to 1. It means the kinematic accuracy completely meets the requirement; For -[ɛ]-α<ɛ<-[ɛ], or [ɛ]≤ɛ≤[ɛ]+α, the membership varies from 0 to 1, which means the kinematic accuracy meets the requirement to some extent; In the other conditions, the membership is 0, meaning the kinematic accuracy does not satisfy the requirement completely. Figure 6.
Membership function of kinematic error.

sec.title: Calculation of fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider
sec.p: On basis of fuzzy probability theory, the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider is written as (44)R=∫-∞+∞fɛ(θ1)·μA~(ɛ)dθ1

In this case, the allowable error values are given, thus the calculation of the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider can be achieved by the equation (45) (45)R=p(A~)=φ(α1,α2)-φ(β1,β2) where, α1=[ɛ]-μɛσɛ, α2=[ɛ]+a-μɛσɛ, β1=-[ɛ]-a-μɛσɛ, β2=-[ɛ]-μɛσɛ, φ(α1,α2)=1α2-α1{[α2φ(α2)-α1φ(α1)]+ 12π[exp(-α222)-exp(-α122)]}, and φ(β1,β2)=1β2-β1× {[β2φ(β2)-β1φ(β1)]+12π[exp(-β222)-exp(-β122)]}.

Thus, with the values of allowable error and dimension parameters of mechanism given, from equations (25) and (43), the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider can be calculated using Newton iteration method in MATLAB.

sec.title: Numerical simulation
sec.p:
A set of optimized length parameters of the presses and values of σli corresponding to li (mm) are shown in Tables 2 and 3. Table 2.
Length parameters of the presses.
l1 l2 l3 l4 l5 l6 l7 l8 l9
480 1350 480 1350 480 1350 1200 1000 1750
a b c d1 d2 d3 h1 h2
950 780 470 2500 1500 300 2200 1600
Table 3.
Values of σli corresponding to li.
σl1 σl2 σl3 σl4 σl5 σl6 σl7
0.0105 0.02083 0.0105 0.02083 0.0105 0.02083 0.0175
σl8 σl9 σa σb σc σh1 σh2
0.0150 0.0250 0.0150 0.0133 0.0105 0.0250 0.0250
In this case, the maximum ram travel is 1240 mm, satisfying the requirement of the drawing process with the stroke travel of 1000 mm.

Cranks rotate from 0° to 360°, and at every position with an increment of 10°, the values of the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider are shown in Table 4 and Figure 7. From the table and figure, values of the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider at every position with an increment of 10° are higher than 0.99 and varying by a certain rule. Figure 7.
Values of the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider vs crank rotation angles.
Table 4.
Values of the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider at every position with an increment of 10°.
5 15 20 30
0.9957 0.9963 0.9968 0.9973
40 50 60 70
0.9977 0.9980 0.9982 0.9983

0.9983 0.9981 0.9977 0.9972

0.9965 0.9957 0.9947 0.9938

0.9920 0.9924 0.9927 0.9930

0.9932 0.9933 0.9934 0.9934
280 290 300 310
0.9934 0.9934 0.9935 0.9937
320 330 340 355
0.9939 0.9942 0.9947 0.9952

In general, the forming process can be divided into three phases: rapid approach, working motion, and rapid return. A typical deep-drawing process is used in the numerical simulation. The motion of the slider is expressed as a function of time as follows (also shown in Figure 8) (46)s={-4832.14283t3+4716.071417t2t∈[0,0.5]2789.02117(t-0.5)3-2532.14283(t-0.5)21091.96425(t-0.5)+575t∈[0.5,0.8]-63.161375(t-0.8)3-22.02381(t-0.8)2325.71425(t-0.8)+750t∈[0.8,2.0]-1666.667(t-2)3-250(t-2)2+1000t∈[2.0,2.5]5666.667(t-2.5)3-2750(t-2.5)2-1500(t-2.5)+729.167t∈[2.5,3.0] Theoretically, in the drawing process, cranks of servo mechanical presses can start rotating at any position as long as the presses are able to achieve the stroke of forming process. As shown in Figure 7, the values of the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider are higher when the cranks rotate from 10° to 130° approximately than that of any other ranges, which can serve as criteria for determining the starting position of cranks. As a result, in order to increase system reliability, a specific initial position can be determined so that cranks would rotate into this angle intervals (10°–130°) when slider is in working motion phase which is the most important one of the three phases. Figure 8.
A typical deep-drawing process.

Based on the inverse kinematics analysis and in use of MATLAB and ADAMS, a motion simulation can be conducted and a series of figures are shown as follows (Figure 9). Figure 9.
Variations of position, velocity, and acceleration of slider vs time: (a) variations of position of slider vs time; (b) variations of velocity of slider vs time; (c) variations of acceleration of slider vs time.

list-item.p: Based on the theory of GF sets, a new type of presses driven by three servo motors in parallel is proposed, which provides a new direction for the design of heavy payload manipulating equipment.

The inverse and forward kinematics analyses of this novel type of mechanical servo presses are conducted, on the basis of which the forward position analysis provides the foundation for the calculation of the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider.

According to the calculation process, the method of calculating the fuzzy reliability of kinematic accuracy of slider based on fuzzy theory does overcome the unreasonable phenomena of ‘complete satisfaction or not’ of traditional methods and reflect the engineering practice to a greater extent.

When cranks rotate from 0° to 360° with 10° increments, the values of the fuzzy reliability of slider accuracy can be obtained, and based on the analysis of these, numerical simulation is conducted using a typical deep-drawing process.

sec.title: Funding
sec.p: This study was supported by National Major S&T Special Project of China (2010ZX04004-112).
